New Records: Afghanistan’s 154-run opening partnership between Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran is the second-highest in men’s T20 World Cup history
Key Match Events: Fazalhaq Farooqi took 5 wickets for just 9 runs
Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran’s opening partnership was the second highest in men’s T20 World Cup history
Masaba claimed a piece of cricket history for the East African nation after taking his country’s first ever World Cup wicket
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan captain Rashid Khan said it was the kind of start they wanted as a team
Rashid Khan emphasized the importance of mindset in cricket
Post-Match Reflections: Uganda skipper Masaba took positives from his team’s T20 World Cup debut, despite the heavy defeat
Masaba said it was a pretty special moment for Uganda to be at the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan produced a dominant bowling and batting performance to thrash debutants Uganda by 125 runs
Fazalhaq Farooqi spearheaded a clinical bowling performance with five wickets for just nine runs
